page.title: 10AN OLD RESIDENT_SKELMERSDALE
page.content: WHAT WAS THE OLD TOWN LIKE?(contd.) Skelmersdale used to be centred around Sandy Lane.That was a very busy place with more than 40 shops.You could buy anything from a pin to a piano. WHAT MAJOR CHANGES HAVE YOU SEEN? With the New Town came lots of outsiders,mainly from Liverpool,so the town lost its family atmosphere.There used to be a railway,that's gone now.All the work was in the collieries so nobody travelled out of the town. ARE THE CHANGES FOR THE BETTER? I have mixed feelings.We must progress but I don't think the New Town has lived up to expectations.There should be more amenities like a theatre,a cinema for this district,a good dance hall and better recreational facilities for the very young and for the aged.
